Gloria — Hotel Booking Analytics

Interactive dashboards exploring hotel booking patterns, cancellation dynamics, and guest segmentation

Welcome to the Hotel Booking Analytics Dashboard. This page contains two interactive visualizations created from hotel booking data. Each dashboard provides insights that can help hotel managers optimize pricing, reduce cancellations, and improve guest satisfaction.

If a visualization doesn't load immediately, try refreshing the page or click the file link below each dashboard to open it directly.

Lead Time & Cancellation Analysis

Understanding booking patterns and cancellation drivers

3 Visualizations

This dashboard explores the relationship between lead time (time between booking and arrival) and cancellation rates. By analyzing these patterns, hotel managers can identify high-risk booking periods and adjust policies to minimize cancellations.

Lead time density by hotel type
Cancellation rate vs. lead time with confidence intervals
Cancellation heatmap filtered by lead time
Embedded file: gloria_View1.html

Guest Segmentation & Service Analysis

Identifying guest groups and their service requirements

2 Visualizations

This view segments hotel guests based on travel composition, booking patterns, and service requirements. Understanding these segments helps hotels tailor services, optimize pricing strategies, and allocate resources effectively to enhance guest satisfaction.

Guest stay composition heatmap
Special requests bubble chart
Violin/matrix cancellation analysis
Embedded file: gloria_view2.html

Important Notes & Instructions

  • Keep all three HTML files (gloria_index.html, gloria_view1.html, gloria_view2.html) in the same folder for the embedded visualizations to work properly.
  • For local viewing, some browsers may restrict iframe loading. If visualizations don't appear, try running a local server or adjust your browser security settings.
  • To adjust the iframe height for better viewing, modify the CSS classes .view1 and .view2 in the style section.
  • These dashboards are responsive and should work on mobile devices, though complex visualizations are best viewed on larger screens.
